q: How do you check BO for EAGLE?
a: Go to the EAGLE website ➜ Order Status; if marked OOS after PO, it appears in Tracking Info/Remark.
Ask the supplier by phone only.
Wait for warehouse to report it.

q: How do you check BO for TYC?
a: Go to Purchase mailbox (iStore SO# email) and compare ordered vs allocated QTY, or check PO-TYC ➜ backordered folder.
Open the Vendor Slack and search for BO.

q: What is an NSF SKU?
a: A SKU no longer sold by the supplier, fulfilled with an alternate SKU.
A SKU that is always shipped LTL.
A SKU with free freight from supplier.

q: Which of the following is a valid example of an NSF SKU?
Where do you check daily feed inventory from suppliers?
How do you cancel a USAuto order that already has a quote ID?
a: Email Team Kool Vue East via the purchase mailbox with the PO Number and Order ID.
Delete the PO from the spreadsheet.
Open a carrier claim with FedEx.
Message the buyer to cancel directly in Marketplace.

q: Who are our current wholesale customers?
What do we call shipments used for large items (hoods, bumpers, large grilles)?
What is the component SKU of CLX-M1-322-2027L-AG-CL360A3?
How do you recognize a set SKU?
a: CLX denotes set SKUs; order 1 SKU and receive both sides.
PLX denotes set SKUs; you always order two supplier SKUs.
Any SKU with “M1” is automatically a set.
Any SKU containing a hyphen is a set.

q: Golden SKU vs Component SKU — which statement is correct?
a: Golden SKUs are the marketplace SKUs; Component SKUs are the supplier-ordered SKUs.
Golden SKUs are supplier SKUs; Component SKUs are marketplace SKUs.
Both are the same; names vary by team.
Golden SKUs only apply to LTL items.

q: Why do we send a JWL for an OOS Amazon order?
a: To avoid removal when there’s a same-SKU cancellation within 30 days.
To upgrade orders to expedited shipping.
To request partial shipment from supplier.

q: What’s the purpose of JWL on eBay?
a: Reduce cancellations and late shipments when an item is OOS.

q: When someone provides only a SKU and asks for order details, where do you look first?
a: NJ PO spreadsheet (use Find across Workbook for the SKU) to get PO name, order #, customer and address.

q: Give an example of a shipping restriction with USAuto.
Usauto order has a PO Box address. What’s the correct approach?
a: Verify in CA/MP; if a physical address exists validate in SS and update; otherwise email buyer for a physical address and cancel/refund if none.
Ask warehouse to rebox and ship UPS.

q: How do we submit orders from Alpharex and KSource?
Which carriers are NOT allowed for KEMA orders?
What are the PO cut-off times (morning and afternoon)?
A warehouse says a returned item arrived. What should you do?
a: Search tracking in SS/CA, get the order #, review MP/3D conversations for reason, inform WH and ask to stock if appropriate.
Create a return label and resend.
Ask carrier to destroy the item.

q: Can we cancel an Amazon order if the item is OOS?
a: Yes, provided there’s no cancellation of the exact same SKU within 30 days and it’s OOS everywhere.
Yes, always allowed with no conditions.
No, Amazon orders can’t be cancelled.
Only if the buyer opens a case.

q: Proper uses of Google Voice for the team include…
a: Contacting suppliers, verifying customer info, and addressing carrier calls when needed.

q: You see an ARTOTEK order in ZM. What should you do?
a: Check if it’s in-house; if not, cross-fulfill to Big 3/other suppliers (we no longer order from Artotek).
Proceed to order from Artotek as usual.

q: WC order (not USAuto) has a PO BOX and only FedEx meets EDD/cost. What’s the process?
a: Verify address in CA/MP, check DIM and NPM, contact buyer for a physical address.
Ship FedEx anyway; PO Boxes are fine.
Ask warehouse to deliver by hand.

q: Buyer later provides a physical address for that order. What’s next?
a: Validate the address in SS and proceed with labeling as usual.
